text: I can't tell yet this morning, I have not seen any fire since a little after 5:00pmEDT last night but my clients are not usually active until later in the morning, maybe another hour or two.  I do see this message in my portal today:

I have been seeing those fields in my payloads all this year when I first set them up.  I just don't think they have updated the docs yet.  They do document subscription type (partial list shown below) but they don't say its part of the payload.  Source ID gives me the user id if a user made the change, otherwise it references another source made the change (an API call for example).
Personally I like to capture them and process them later in batches.  Mine look like this for reference on those fields:

6Sense is saying that their integration is failing due to not having sufficient scopes. Here's the error message they passed along:
```Request <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/search> for HubSpot failed with status - 403 and message - {"status":"error","message":"The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use.```
The integration URL I've used appears to include CRM Deal read/write, though:
```<https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=X&scope=sales-email-read%20crm.schemas.custom.write%20content%20timeline%20forms%20tickets%20e-commerce%20forms-uploaded-files%20crm.lists.read%20crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.import%20crm.objects.contacts.write%20crm.schemas.custom.read%20crm.objects.custom.read%20crm.objects.custom.write%20crm.objects.companies.write%20crm.schemas.contacts.read%20media_bridge.read%20crm.lists.write%20crm.objects.companies.read%20crm.objects.deals.read%20crm.objects.deals.write%20crm.schemas.companies.read%20crm.schemas.deals.read%20crm.objects.owners.read%20crm.objects.quotes.write%20crm.objects.quotes.read%20crm.schemas.quotes.read%20crm.objects.line_items.read%20crm.objects.line_items.write%20crm.schemas.line_items.read%20crm.schemas.contacts.write>```
Their team and I are both unsure of what could be causing the error. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Sorry, I thought you meant there are all the API docs. :smile:
